revised_title: Geological Causes of Changes in Earth's Axis Position
tldr: The author discusses the possibility of geological causes, such as changes in the position of the Earth's axis, contributing to climatal changes. They propose that the Earth's crust, being a fluid mass, can change its external form and position when revolving on a new axis, leading to alterations in the climate. The author also considers the existence of a fluid nucleus within the Earth's crust and its potential effects on the axis of rotation.
